newsitem.title: USA: Illinois Central acquisition contributes to Q4 net.
newsitem.headline: Illinois Central acquisition contributes to Q4 net.

text.p: Illinois Central Corp said Tuesday its newly acquired CCP Holdings Inc rail operations contributed $19.2 million in revenue and $6.1 million in operating income in the fourth quarter.
Excluding CCP, which was acquired in June 1996, Illinois Central's fourth quarter revenues were down 3.2 percent despite a four percent increase in ton-miles.

Weaknesses in grain, paper, forest products and bulk commodities offset gains in coal, intermodal and other commodity groups, Illinois Central said. This business mix resulted in an overall decrease in revenue per ton-mile.

Earlier, Illinois Central reported fourth quarter earnings of $0.65 a share, up from $0.59 a year ago. Both quarterly periods included gains of $0.07 a share. For the year, it earned $2.21 a share, up from year-ago earnings of $1.88 a share after an $0.18 charge.
Illinois Central said its full-year operating ratio improved by one percentage point to 63.3 percent.
The company's two main subsidiaries are the 2,600-mile Illinois Central freight railroad and the 850-mile Chicago Central freight system.
